poem:
"Of Deleted Digital Footprints"

A grid vanishes - an Ayatollah's
serrated echoes, truncated in pixel ghost-
Iran divides, deepfake descends - a sabotage distinct.

Menlo Park's Meta stirs - an architect
on sands of Gaza, disrupted, no host.

In digital dusk - a supremacy pruned, 
Hamas shadows hang, a war's bitter boast. 

Unseen voices cry - Silence - the most potent post.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Instagram and Facebook delete the accounts of Iran’s supreme leader Meta has removed Instagram and Facebook accounts run on behalf of Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, following criticism over his support for Hamas after the group’s 7 October attack on Israel that sparked the months-long war still raging in the Gaza Strip, the company confirmed on Friday. Related: Iran-backed hackers interrupt UAE TV streaming services with deepfake news Meta, based in Menlo Park, California,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
